node.title: Do the vaccines protect against the Omicron COVID-19 variant?
node.alt: A woman holds up a needle next to a vial.
node.description: Do the Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca vaccines protect against the new variant? The short answer is probably. But we'll know for certain "within days".
node.content:
["The Omicron variant has been generating anxiety across the world\u00a0since being declared a COVID-19 variant of concern by the World Health Organization (WHO) over the weekend.", "While scientists do not know a lot about this strain yet \u2014 and it may be less severe than Delta \u2014\u00a0it is believed to be more transmissible than previous variants.", "It sparked the closure of some international borders and caused\u00a0travel guidance\u00a0to be changed in Australia.", "Australia has\u00a0some of the highest vaccination rates in the world, with case numbers, plateauing\u00a0since\u00a0News South Wales and Victoria opened up.\u00a0\u00a0", "But that is with the Delta strain.\u00a0", "So, what about the vaccines? Will they work against Omicron?", "
Will Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca\u00a0protect you?\u00a0
", "The simple answer right now is \"most likely\" \u2014 but no one\u00a0knows for certain.", "This\u00a0strain has been detected in vaccinated and unvaccinated people in South Africa\u00a0and, according to the experts, is so far\u00a0causing\u00a0extreme fatigue but only mild disease.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "According to Westmead Institute virologist\u00a0Tony Cunningham, scientists around the world \u2014 including those in Australia \u2014 would be looking at whether protective antibodies in the vaccines used in Australia\u00a0were \"sufficiently high\" to cover this strain.\u00a0", "\"My suspicion is the vaccines we use in Australia [Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca] will cover severe disease against the Omicron variant,\"\u00a0said Professor Cunningham, a vaccine expert with four\u00a0decades experience.\u00a0", "\"It clearly can infect people that are immunised.", "\"But, remember, we only need a small amount of antibody to protect against severe disease.\"", "Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly\u00a0said scientists would be doing laboratory testing to establish whether the current vaccines work for certain.\u00a0", "\"Virus is being grown in Australia from that first case that\u00a0was diagnosed [on Sunday]\u00a0and, internationally, we can do those tests\u00a0[and] then\u00a0look at what's happening,\" Professor Kelly said.", "\"That can be done in days.\"\u00a0", "", "
Scientists working to understand Omicron strain
", "Deakin University epidemiologist Catherine Bennett said scientists would also be analysing real-time infection rates in South Africa and other African countries for the rate of infection between vaccinated and non-vaccinated people.\u00a0", "However, one of the\u00a0issues was the low percentage of vaccinated people in the region. In South Africa, where she said\u00a0most of the epidemiological work was being done, the vaccination rate was about 24.1 per cent for the entire population.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "\"It's a bit early to tell right now [because of that],\" Professor Bennett said.\u00a0", "\"The\u00a0[two infected] people who arrived in Australia were fully\u00a0vaccinated.", "\"But we know the vaccines have stood up against other variants, particularly for severe illness. I think it should be confident that that is still the case.\"\u00a0", "
Vaccines for the variants?\u00a0
", "The vaccine makers such as Pfizer and Moderna have been working on what some are labelling the \"next generation\" vaccines.\u00a0\u00a0", "These mRNA vaccines would be able to target particular variants circulating, such as Omicron.\u00a0", "Professor Bennett said that, by early next year, it could\u00a0take only \"a couple of weeks\" to produce one, according to the companies involved.\u00a0", "\"That\u00a0was always one of the strengths of the mRNA technology, they could\u00a0do that quickly, and not produce a whole\u00a0new vaccine,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"But we expect to hear more news about the effectiveness of [current]\u00a0vaccines on Omicron\u00a0and it will obviously determine how much of an effort they were put into a next-generation vaccine and whether that is it required or not.\"", "", "
Vaccine effectiveness against Omicron to be known in weeks
", "This was backed by Professor Cunningham, who said there was \"no point\" developing a new vaccine to target Omicron if the current vaccines worked, or if it did not become the dominant strain in the world.\u00a0", "However, he said, vaccine developers \u2014 including his own team at the Westmead Institute \u2014 were working on their own next-generation\u00a0vaccines that were\u00a0variant-resistant.", "\"It's a bit like what people are trying to do with the\u00a0universal\u00a0flu shot,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"You have to be smarter than the virus as it moves. That's the key. Do you keep up with changes in virus, or do you try to do smarter and second-guess it?\"\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "
Severity a factor\u00a0
", "According to Professor Cunningham, another factor governments and the WHO\u00a0would be assessing was the severity of the variant.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "This was backed by Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly, who said early analysis\u00a0showed it was\u00a0relatively mild compared with previous versions of the virus.", "But, he\u00a0said, there were only a \"a few hundred\" confirmed or suspected cases so far.\u00a0", "\"It will only be when we have larger numbers that we can make that\u00a0assessment\u00a0[of the severity of Omicron],\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Just to be very clear, this is still SARS-CoV-2. It's not a new virus. It\u00a0is a change of that particular virus.\"", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
